intro: Octomeria semiteres, commonly known as the narrow-leaf octomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Octomeria semiteres is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
